content.description:
The name and grade comes from the Carolina Climbers Coalition guidebook.

Climb the left side of the 30 ft. tall buttress that lies left of the Big Arete area. Can be climbed different ways but you will end on the left face directly above the trail
content.protection: Bolted Anchors. To set the anchors, scramble up the chimney behind the buttress to the top. On the top there is a surface big enough for 3-4 people to lay/sit. These anchors are fairly easy to set.

climbs.name: Smooth Sailing (aka Lloyd Would Have Liked It)

content.description: Follow the face up a bolt line past a tree growing up in a crack.  Surmount the ledge, and climb the right face of the arete up to the crux section, a blank seeming face where a couple 5.10 crimps and slopey feet will let you go for the awesome incut top out.  There are brand new (courtesy of the Carolina Climber's Coalition) bolts and rings to lower from.
content.location: To the right side of the ledge 20' above the trail.

content.description: Follow 2 bolts on the left side of the face to an upper ledge.  Pull a small overhang with 2 more bolts and trend right towards a third bolt.  It is strongly suggested to place gear in the small horizontal crack before moving to the anchors (Crux).
content.protection: MIXED ROUTE: 6 bolts + anchors.  Bring C3 or TCU to protect the crux.
content.location: The route starts on the earthen ledge 10 feet above the trail.  Look for the bolt line on the left side of the rock face.

content.description:
The exact route is unclear in the Carolina Climbers Coalition guidebook, but here is the route generally agreed upon:

Climb the center of the 30 ft. tall buttress that lies to the left of the base of the Big Arete area.  Route appears to go over a little one-move roof and ends at the base of a pine tree in a crack (this tree makes it hard to top out on this climb).
content.protection: Natural anchors.  To set anchors, scramble up the chimney behind the buttress to set.  On top, there is a tree and 2 large blocks about the size of a car motor.  About 50 feet of webbing required. Try to avoid tying anchor to the poor little tree, use the blocks instead.

climbs.name: Bet Ya Can't Eat Just One

content.description: Climb the right side of the 30 ft. tall buttress to the left of the base of the Big Arete area.  Climb begins in the center and gradually follows right along with the crack.
content.protection: Bolted anchors. Scramble up the chimney to the right of the climb, behind the buttress, to set up toprope. Can be led on gear up to 3" and well protected.

content.description: Follow the bolts (3) from the right side to the ledge.  Then climb the right side of the arete to the anchors on the left face of the arete (Man Overboard).
content.location: The start is ~20 ft above the trail on the right side of the face.
